00025 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_oid_h__
00026 #define INCLUDE_git_oid_h__
00027 
00028 #include "common.h"
00029 #include "types.h"
00030 
00031 /**
00032  * @file git2/oid.h
00033  * @brief Git object id routines
00034  * @defgroup git_oid Git object id routines
00035  * @ingroup Git
00036  * @{
00037  */
00038 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00039 
00040 /** Size (in bytes) of a raw/binary oid */
00041 #define GIT_OID_RAWSZ 20
00042 
00043 /** Size (in bytes) of a hex formatted oid */
00044 #define GIT_OID_HEXSZ (GIT_OID_RAWSZ * 2)
00045 
00046 /** Unique identity of any object (commit, tree, blob, tag). */
00047 typedef struct {
00048         /** raw binary formatted id */
00049         unsigned char id[GIT_OID_RAWSZ];
00050 } git_oid;
00051 
00052 /**
00053  * Parse a hex formatted object id into a git_oid.
00054  * @param out oid structure the result is written into.
00055  * @param str input hex string; must be pointing at the start of
00056  *        the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes
00057  *        needed for an oid encoded in hex (40 bytes).
00058  * @return GIT_SUCCESS if valid; GIT_ENOTOID on failure.
00059  */
00060 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_oid_mkstr(git_oid *out, const char *str);
00061 
00062 /**
00063  * Copy an already raw oid into a git_oid structure.
00064  * @param out oid structure the result is written into.
00065  * @param raw the raw input bytes to be copied.
00066  */
00067 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_oid_mkraw(git_oid *out, const unsigned char *raw);
00068 
00069 /**
00070  * Format a git_oid into a hex string.
00071  * @param str output hex string; must be pointing at the start of
00072  *        the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes
00073  *        needed for an oid encoded in hex (40 bytes).  Only the
00074  *        oid digits are written; a '\\0' terminator must be added
00075  *        by the caller if it is required.
00076  * @param oid oid structure to format.
00077  */
00078 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_oid_fmt(char *str, const git_oid *oid);
00079 
00080 /**
00081  * Format a git_oid into a loose-object path string.
00082  * <p>
00083  * The resulting string is "aa/...", where "aa" is the first two
00084  * hex digitis of the oid and "..." is the remaining 38 digits.
00085  *
00086  * @param str output hex string; must be pointing at the start of
00087  *        the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes
00088  *        needed for an oid encoded in hex (41 bytes).  Only the
00089  *        oid digits are written; a '\\0' terminator must be added
00090  *        by the caller if it is required.
00091  * @param oid oid structure to format.
00092  */
00093 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_oid_pathfmt(char *str, const git_oid *oid);
00094 
00095 /**
00096  * Format a gid_oid into a newly allocated c-string.
00097  * @param oid the oid structure to format
00098  * @return the c-string; NULL if memory is exhausted.  Caller must
00099  *         deallocate the string with free().
00100  */
00101 GIT_EXTERN(char *) git_oid_allocfmt(const git_oid *oid);
00102 
00103 /**
00104  * Format a git_oid into a buffer as a hex format c-string.
00105  * <p>
00106  * If the buffer is smaller than GIT_OID_HEXSZ+1, then the resulting
00107  * oid c-string will be truncated to n-1 characters. If there are
00108  * any input parameter errors (out == NULL, n == 0, oid == NULL),
00109  * then a pointer to an empty string is returned, so that the return
00110  * value can always be printed.
00111  *
00112  * @param out the buffer into which the oid string is output.
00113  * @param n the size of the out buffer.
00114  * @param oid the oid structure to format.
00115  * @return the out buffer pointer, assuming no input parameter
00116  *         errors, otherwise a pointer to an empty string.
00117  */
00118 GIT_EXTERN(char *) git_oid_to_string(char *out, size_t n, const git_oid *oid);
00119 
00120 /**
00121  * Copy an oid from one structure to another.
00122  * @param out oid structure the result is written into.
00123  * @param src oid structure to copy from.
00124  */
00125 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_oid_cpy(git_oid *out, const git_oid *src);
00126 
00127 /**
00128  * Compare two oid structures.
00129  * @param a first oid structure.
00130  * @param b second oid structure.
00131  * @return <0, 0, >0 if a < b, a == b, a > b.
00132  */
00133 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_oid_cmp(const git_oid *a, const git_oid *b);
00134 
00135 /**
00136  * OID Shortener object
00137  */
00138 typedef struct git_oid_shorten git_oid_shorten;
00139 
00140 /**
00141  * Create a new OID shortener.
00142  *
00143  * The OID shortener is used to process a list of OIDs
00144  * in text form and return the shortest length that would
00145  * uniquely identify all of them.
00146  *
00147  * E.g. look at the result of `git log --abbrev`.
00148  *
00149  * @param min_length The minimal length for all identifiers,
00150  *              which will be used even if shorter OIDs would still
00151  *              be unique.
00152  *      @return a `git_oid_shorten` instance, NULL if OOM
00153  */
00154 git_oid_shorten *git_oid_shorten_new(size_t min_length);
00155 
00156 /**
00157  * Add a new OID to set of shortened OIDs and calculate
00158  * the minimal length to uniquely identify all the OIDs in
00159  * the set.
00160  *
00161  * The OID is expected to be a 40-char hexadecimal string.
00162  * The OID is owned by the user and will not be modified
00163  * or freed.
00164  *
00165  * For performance reasons, there is a hard-limit of how many
00166  * OIDs can be added to a single set (around ~22000, assuming
00167  * a mostly randomized distribution), which should be enough
00168  * for any kind of program, and keeps the algorithm fast and
00169  * memory-efficient.
00170  *
00171  * Attempting to add more than those OIDs will result in a
00172  * GIT_ENOMEM error
00173  *
00174  * @param os a `git_oid_shorten` instance
00175  * @param text_oid an OID in text form
00176  * @return the minimal length to uniquely identify all OIDs
00177  *              added so far to the set; or an error code (<0) if an
00178  *              error occurs.
00179  */
00180 int git_oid_shorten_add(git_oid_shorten *os, const char *text_oid);
00181 
00182 /**
00183  * Free an OID shortener instance
00184  * 
00185  * @param os a `git_oid_shorten` instance
00186  */
00187 void git_oid_shorten_free(git_oid_shorten *os);
00188 
00189 /** @} */
00190 GIT_END_DECL
00191 #endif
